data.title: Ex-UBS Boss Exits Family Office for $8 Billion Walgreens Fortune
data.meta_description: A former UBS Group AG executive has stepped down as head of billionaire Stefano Pessina’s family office, ending a decades-long business relationship that helped build the Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. chairman’s fortune.
data.text:
Edoardo Spezzotti was CEO of Ergeny for about six years

He helped Sefano Pessina take Alliance Boots private in 2007

A former UBS Group AG executive has stepped down as head of billionaire Stefano Pessina ’s family office, ending a decades-long business relationship that helped build the Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. chairman’s fortune.

Edoardo Spezzotti recently retired as chief executive officer of Ergeny, the Monaco-based private investment firm for Pessina and his wife Ornella Barra , according to a person familiar with the matter, who asked not to be identified as the details are private. The 71-year-old was formerly vice-chairman of UBS’s wealth-management division and chairman of its family office unit.
